main event: An unidentified flying object was sighted by the crew of a MATS Stratocruiser aircraft over the Atlantic Ocean, approximately 500 miles southeast of Gander, Newfoundland, on July 6, 1956.
interesting points: The object was described as a bright light that was much larger and brighter than normal aircraft lights, and it appeared to pulsate or fluctuate in intensity.
The crew was unable to determine the exact size, shape, or altitude of the object, but they were certain it was not a conventional aircraft.
The object was observed for approximately 2 to 3 minutes before disappearing from view.
The weather conditions were clear with no cloud cover.

Another report describes an unidentified object that crossed an area under surveillance for 500 miles southeast of Gander, Newfoundland, in just 5 minutes, indicating an average speed of over 6,000 mph.
sighted object: bright light, possibly a pulsating or fluctuating object
location: Approximately 500 miles southeast of Gander, Newfoundland
witnesses: crew of a MATS Stratocruiser aircraft
